controller

Class CollectController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.CollectController

  • public class CollectController
extends java.lang.Object
    CollectController is the main screen of Collectibase and allows the user to navigate between collection pages.
    Author:
    Jesus Nieto

      CollectController() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void alert()
      alert is responsible for displaying an alert message if no collection was selected.
      void changeScene(java.lang.String a)
      changeScene switches to a collection's scene page respective to user's choice.
      void getChoice(javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox<java.lang.String> choice)
      getChoice is responsible for initializing the choiceValue which is the collection that the user selected.
      void handleButton()
      This function handles everything from reseting choice box values to passing strings, to alert messages, to changing scene 1) when it resets the choice box value, the purpose of it is to make it easier for the back button for the next scene
      void initialize()
      initialize initialized all drop-down menu boxes along with the collections that are contained inside them.
      void passString(java.lang.String y)
      passString initializes the passString to be used when deciding which collection stage to open.
      void resetChoiceBoxValue(javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox<java.lang.String> choiceBox)
      resetChoiceBoxValue is responsible for clearing the user's choice once selected.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        initialize initialized all drop-down menu boxes along with the collections that are contained inside them.

      • handleButton

        public void handleButton()
        This function handles everything from reseting choice box values to passing strings, to alert messages, to changing scene 1) when it resets the choice box value, the purpose of it is to make it easier for the back button for the next scene

      • getChoice

        public void getChoice(javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox<java.lang.String> choice)
        getChoice is responsible for initializing the choiceValue which is the collection that the user selected.
        Parameters:
        choiceBox - choice: The user's selected collection from the drop-down boxes.

      • alert

        public void alert()
        alert is responsible for displaying an alert message if no collection was selected.

      • passString

        public void passString(java.lang.String y)
        passString initializes the passString to be used when deciding which collection stage to open.
        Parameters:
        String - y: The collection to be opened
